dialog:
Input directory Path to input file{cb+bb;GUI;/home/csdms/sims/marssim/Fluvial_no_cratering/} GUI String
MARSSIM application title: MARSSIM application title Landscape evolution model String
Variable information filename: Variable information filename varinfo.dat String
Random seed: A integer random seed 4632819 Int
0 2100000000
Switch for new simulation: If set to 1, start a new simulation. Otherwise, continue from a saved state. 1 Int
0 1
Switch for fluvial and slope modeling: If set to 1, fluvial and slope processes are modeled. 1 Int
0 1
Switch for impact crater modeling: If set to 1, impact craters are modeled. 1 Int
0 1
Switch for lava inundation: If set to 1, lava inundation is modeled. 0 Int
0 1
Switch for eolian depositon: If set to 1, eolian transport is modeled. 0 Int
0 1
Switch for ocean processes: If set to 1, ocean processes are modeled. 0 Int
0 1
Switch for accretion and ablation: If set to 1, model accretion and ablation. 0 Int
0 1
Switch for lake evaporation: If set to 1, model runoff and evaporation with lakes. 0 Int
0 1
Number of columns for DEM: Number of columns for DEM 256 Int
1 2000
Number of rows in DEM: Number of rows in DEM 256 Int
1 2000
Number of vertical cells: Number of vertical cells 256 Int
0 1000
Grid cell size: Grid cell size in arbitrary units. See conversion factor below. 0.4 Float
0.0 1000.0
Vertical scale units: Elevation units (vertical). Must be same as grid cell size units (horizontal). 1.0 Float
0.0 1000.0
Convert-to-meters factor: Factor to convert grid cell size and vertical scale units to meters. 1000.0 Float
0.0 100000.0
Switch for variable erosion rate: If set to 1, erosion rate will vary in time in the specified manner. Otherwise, model parameters are constant. 0 Int
0 1
Boundary lowering rate: Rate at which the boundary is lowering over time [meters / year]. To be used only with a nonperiodic vertical boundary. 0.0 Float
0.0 1000.0
Channel timestep scale factor: Channel process timestep scale factor. 250.0 Float
0.0 100000.0
Default channel time step: Channel process timestep [years] 20.0 Float
0.0 100000.0
Maximum timestep: Maximum allowed timestep [years] 250.0 Float
0.0 100000.0
Minimum timestep: Minimum allowed timestep [years] 10.0 Float
0.0 100000.0
Sediment timestep scale factor: Sediment timestep scale factor (EXPLAIN) 0.1 Float
0.0 10.0
Mass wasting timestep scale factor: Mass wasting timestep scale factor (EXPLAIN) 100.1 Float
0.0 100000.0
I-coordinate for center of debug window: I-coordinate for center of debug window. Used for debug mode. 25 Int
1 2000
J-coordinate for center of debug window: I-coordinate for center of debug window. Used for debug mode. 50 Int
1 2000
Size of debug window, I-direction: Size of debug window, I-direction. Used for debug mode. 4 Int
3 100
Size of debug window, J-direction: Size of debug window, I-direction. Used for debug mode. 15 Int
3 100
Switch to print debug info: If set to 1, print info in specified debug window. Affects performance. 0 Int
0 1
Switch to print debug info for special events: If set to 1, print info for special, instantaneous, landscape-modifying events that are programmed in subroutine MAKE_EVENT() in BOUNDARY_CONDITIONS.F90. 0 Int
0 1
Switch to calculate morphometric statistics: If set to 1, calculate morphometric statistics. 0 Int
0 1
Switch to use horizontal lower boundary: If set to 1, southern (lower) boundary is level. Do not use with a periodic lower boundary. 0 Int
0 1
Switch for non-eroding lower boundary: If set to 1, use a non-eroding lower/southern boundary. Can be used in conjunction with a horizontal lower boundary. 0 Int
0 1
Switch for periodic Y axis: If set to 1, use periodic boundary condition along the Y-axis. 1 Int
0 1
Switch for periodic X axis: If set to 1, use periodic boundary condition along the X-axis. 1 Int
0 1
Switch to allow flow across all boundaries: If set to 1, all boundaries are potential flow exits and are non-eroding. 0 Int
0 1
-->
Starting iteration: Generally this is zero for new simulations. 0 Int
0 100000
Present time: Generally this is zero for new simulations [years] 0.0 Float
0.0 100000.0
Maximum iteration: The number of timesteps or iterations to be used in the simulation. 2500 Int
1 1000000
Maximum simulation time: The maximum time that the simulation is allowed to run [years]. 1.0e+10 Float
0.0 1e10
Iterations between prints: The number of iterations (or timesteps) between writing out a lot of info. 500 Int
0 10000
Simulation progress interval: HOW OFTEN TO SUMMARIZE SIMULATION PREOGRESS. GENERALLY SHOULD BE THE SAME AS ELEVINTERVAL 500 Int
0 10000
Recalculate gradient interval: Number of iterations before recalculating gradients and contributing areas. (Currently hardwired) 1 Int
1 1
Write change interval: Number of iterations before printing out information on the rate of change in gradients and flow directions. (Currently hardwired) 20 Int
20 20
Morphometric channel threshold: This has to do with the definition of where channels start when printing out morphometric statistics. 5 Int
0 10000
Matrices to output: What matrices to output at ELEVATION_PRINT_INTERVAL times. Each digit represents a flag for writing a particular matrix. From left to write the flags are: (1) elevation, (2) relative elevation, (3) D8 gradient, (4) erode_slope, (5) cfne, (6) cfnw, (7) cfw, (8) cfn, (9) cfne, (10) drainage_area, (11) relative_gradient, (12) regolith and relative resistance. Generally, only first flag is set (elevation). 1000000000000 String
Switch for absolute or relative elevations: If set to 1, write out absolute vs. relative (normalized ??) elevations. 1 Int
0 1
Interval to print out shaded relief images: Shaded relief images are typically generated and saved every 50 to 100 iterations. 50 Int
1 10000
Divergence Interval: Divergence interval 5 Int
0 10000
Switch for wet or dry depressions: If set to 1, all depressions fill with water and overflow. Otherwise, all depressions are infinite sinks for water. Most Mars simulations have used 0, but some simulations with non-periodic BCs use 1. See documentation. 0 Int
0 1
Switch to rescale discharges: If set to 1, then effective discharges are rescaled as a power function of contributing area. (e.g. Q = K * A**E, where E is typically in [0.5, 1.0].) 1 Int
0 1
Switch for random or deterministic flow routing: If set to 1, flow directions will have a random component. This is generally set to 0. 0 Int
0 1
Discharge constant: Used with option to rescale discharges. In that case, Discharge = discharge_constant * Area**discharge_exponent, [meters**3 / second] 3.0e-05 Float
1.0e-6 1.0e-4
Discharge exponent: Used with option to rescale discharges. In that case, Discharge = discharge_constant * Area**discharge_exponent, [meters**3 / second] 0.7 Float
0.0 1.0
Area factor: Area factor. Generally not used. 0.0 Float
-1.0 0.0
Rain depth; Rain depth. 0.000025 Float
0.0 1e2
Rain standard deviation: Rain standard deviation (CHECK THIS) 1.0 Float
0.0 10.0
Switch for divergence-dependent runoff: If set to 1, runoff depth functionally depends on topographic divergence (VARYIELDUSE, 0 or 1). Usually not set. 0 Int
0 1
Mean convergence runoff: Only used if "Divergence dependent runoff" is toggled on. 0.0 Float
0.0 10.0
High convergence runoff: Only used if "Divergence dependent runoff" is toggled on. 1.0 Float
0.0 10.0
Low convergence runoff: Only used if "Divergence dependent runoff" is toggled on. 0.2 Float
0.0 10.0
Iterations between recalculating evaporation rates: Only used if "Lake evaporation" is toggled on. 1 Int
0 10000
Iterations between stocahstic changes in evaporation rates: Only used if "Lake evaporation" is toggled on. 20 Int
0 10000
Mean yearly evaporation depth: Mean yearly evaporation depth [meters] 20.0 Float
0.0 1000.0
Std. deviation of mean evaporation depth: Std. deviation of mean evaporation depth [meters] 0.0 Float
0.0 100.0
Switch to model pelagic deposition: If set to 1, deposition of suspended sediment in enclosed basins is modeled. (IMODEL_PELAGIC_DEPOSITION, 0 or 1) 0 Int
0 1
Wash load fraction: Fraction of sediment delivered to basins that is deposited as pelagic sediment. 0.5 Float
0.0 1.0
Amount of post-deposition: A diffusivity that determines how much post-deposition diffusion occurs in recently-deposited pelagic sediment. 0.2 Float
0.0 1000.0
Switch to model influent rivers: If set to 1, incoming rivers are modeled. 0 Int
0 1
Switch to model fluvial detachment: This should only be set to 0 when slope processes are being modeled and fluvial erosion, transport and deposition are not. 1 Int
0 1
Switch for explicit or implicit channel bed: If set to 1, use EXPLICIT method to model regolith depth (including bare rock). Otherwise use IMPLICIT method. 1 Int
0 1
Model to use for bedrock channel: 0 for Howard model, 1 for Sklar saltation, 2 for Whipple saltation. 0 Int
0 2
Rock tensile strength: Tensile strength of bedrock if saltation model is used. 1.0 Float
0.0 1000.0
Bedrock discharge exponent: In the Howard detachment model (see above) the rate of bedrock erosion is computed as: bedrock_erodibility * (Discharge**bedrock_discharge_exponent) * (Gradient**bedrock_gradient_exponent). 0.3 Float
0.0 1.0
Bedrock gradient exponent: In the Howard detachment model (see above) the rate of bedrock erosion is computed as: bedrock_erodibility * (Discharge**bedrock_discharge_exponent) * (Gradient**bedrock_gradient_exponent). 0.7 Float
0.0 1.0
Bedrock erodibility: In the Howard detachment model (see above) the rate of bedrock erosion is computed as: bedrock_erodibility * (Discharge**bedrock_discharge_exponent) * (Gradient**bedrock_gradient_exponent). Bedrock erodibility could vary in natural landscapes over orders of magnitude from 10*-8 to 10**-2. 1e-4 Float
1e-9 1e-1
Manning roughness parameter: Manning's channel roughness parameter, N 0.03 Float
0.0 1.0
Gravitational constant: 3.7 for Mars, 9.8 for Earth [meters / second**2] 3.7 Float
0.0 100.0
Detachment critical shear: A critical shear stress that must be exceeded in the Howard detachment model before transport occurs [kg / (meter * second**2)]. Usually set to 0. 0.0 Float
0.0 1000.0
Regolith erodibility factor: Determines how much more erodible weathered regolith is as compared to bedrock. Minimum value is 1. 10.0 Float
1.0 1000.0
Regolith critical shear factor: Determines how much less the critical shear stress for detachment of regolith is as compared to bedrock. Generally se to the same value as the regolith erodibility factor. 10.0 Float
1.0 1000.0
Channel width constant: Channel width is computed as: Width = channel_width_constant * (Discharge**channel_width_exponent) [meters]. Generally, mean annual discharge is used. 5.0 Float
0.0 100.0
Channel width exponent: Channel width is computed as: Width = channel_width_constant * (Discharge**channel_width_exponent) [meters]. Generally, mean annual discharge is used. 0.5 Float
0.0 1.0
Switch for variable vegetation resistance: Switch to determine whether variable vegetation modeling is used (ITAUAREA, 0 or 1). 0 Int
0 1
Vegetation upland resistance: See documentation. Only used if "variable vegetation resistance" flag is set. 200.0 Float
0.0 10000.0
Vegetation channel resistance: See documentation. Only used if "variable vegetation resistance" flag is set. 1.0 Float
0.0 10000.0
Vegetation area minimum: See documentation. Only used if "variable vegetation resistance" flag is set. 3000.0 Float
0.0 100000.0
Vegetation area maximum: See documentation. Only used if "variable vegetation resistance" flag is set. 60000.0 Float
0.0 100000.0
Switch to write sediment diagnostics: If set to 1, detailed sediment routing information is printed. (ISEDDEBUG, 0 or 1) 0 Int
0 1
Switch for sediment transport: If set to 1, alluvial channels, deltas and fans are modeled (ISEDIMENT, 0 or 1) 1 Int
0 1
Switch for sediment routing: If set to 1, sediment routing is modeled (ISEDROUTE, 0 or 1). 1 Int
0 1
Switch for sediment diffusion: If set to 1, sediment diffusion is modeled (ISEDDIFFUSE, 0 or 1). 0 Int
0 1
Switch for no-flux lower boundary: If set to 1, a no-flux lower boundary is used (IREFLECT, 0 or 1). 0 Int
0 1
Switch for alluvial smoothing: If set to 1, alluvial depositional surfaces (fans and deltas) are smoothed during deposition (SMOOTHSEDUSE, 0 or 1) 1 Int
0 1
Switch for alluvial rerouting: If set to 1, alluvial rerouting is used. (NEWDIRECTIONUSE, 0 or 1) 1 Int
0 1
Alluvial smoothing factor: Only used if "alluvial rerouting" switch is set. 0.02 Float
0.0 1.0
Switch to read alluvial thickness at start: If set to 1, alluvium thickness is read at beginning of simulation (IREADALLUV, 0 or 1). Generally 0. 0 Int
0 1
Switch to use an ocean: If set to 1, an ocean is used, as when modeling deltas (WATERUSE, 0 or 1). Set to 1 if USEWET is set to 1. 1 Int
0 1
Ocean elevation: If modeling a global ocean, set this to your assumed ocean level. Otherwise, set it to a very low value. -50000.0 Float
-1e6 1e6
Delta foreset gradient: This is the foreset bed gradient. 0.2 Float
0.0 10.0
Sediment 1 exponent: Used in sediment transport relationship. See documentation. 0.5 Float
0.0 2.0
Sediment 2 exponent: Used in sediment transport relationship. See documentation. 0.3 Float
0.0 2.0
Effective discharge ratio: Used in sediment transport relationship. See documentation. 0.6 Float
0.0 1.0
Sediment gradient exponent: Used in sediment transport relationship. See documentation. 0.7 Float
0.0 2.0
Sediment transport exponent: Used in sediment transport relationship. See documentation. 1.5 Float
0.0 2.0
Transport factor: Generally, 40.0 for sand bed, 8.0 for gravel bed. See documentation. 8.0 Float
0.0 50.0
Flow fraction: Fraction of flow used for *******. Set to 1 when modeling erosion by groundwater seepage. See documentation. 0.05 Float
0.0 1.0
Sediment porosity: Sediment porosity [unitless] 0.5 Float
0.0 1.0
Sediment specific gravity: See documentation. (GIVE UNITS HERE.) 2.65 Float
0.0 10.0
Grain size: Typical values are 0.0002 for sand and 0.02 for gravel. [meters] 0.02 Float
0.0 1.0
Transport critical dim shear: Generally not changed. 0.05 Float
0.0 0.1
Switch to use sticky sediment routing: If set to 1, use "sticky" vs. normal sediment. Used in an experiment to model birdfoot deltas. Generally not used. 0 Int
0 1
Sticky routing critical value: Used in an experiment to model birdfoot deltas. Generally not used. 5.0 Float
0.0 50.0
Bedload fraction: Fraction of eroded sediment that is transported as bedload. Used for calculation of alluvial channel gradients. 0.2 Float
0.0 1.0
Rock weathering rate: Rate of bare rock weathering [meters / year] 0.001 Float
1e-6 1e-1
Weather decay rate: Determines how raplidly weathering rate decreases with increasing regolith thickness, based on terrestrial values. 0.03 Float
0.0 1.0
Initial regolith thickness: Initial regolith thickness [meters] 1.0 Float
0.0 1000.0
Switch for two-term weathering: If set to 1, a humped weathering function is used (WEATHER2USE, 0 or 1) 0 Int
0 1
Weathering term 2: Only used if "two term weathering" flag is set. 1.0 Float
0.0 100.0
Weathering decay 2: Only used if "two term weathering" flag is set. 1.0 Float
0.0 100.0
Switch for seepage weathering: If set to 1, seepage-dependent weathering is modeled (ISEEPAGEWEATHER, 0 or 1) 0 Int
0 1
Seepage weathering scale factor: Only used if "seepage weathering" flag is set. 0.001 Float
0.0 1.0
Seepage weathering exponent: Only used if "seepage weathering" flag is set. 1.0 Float
0.0 2.0
Critical bedrock gradient: Maximum steepness of bedrock slope. 2.7 Float
0.0 100.0
Weather multiplier: This scales the rate of bedrock mass wasting. 0.5 Float
0.0 1.0
Weather divergence: If greater than 0, then rate of bedrock weathering will depend on topographic divergence. 0.0 Float
0.0 100.0
Switch to read initial regolith thickness: If set to 1, read initial regolith thickness from file (READREGOLITH, 0 or 1). 0 Int
0 1
Switch for slope erosion modelling: If set to 1, use slope erosion modelling (ISLOPEUSE, 0 or 1). 1 Int
0 1
Slope diffusity: Determines relative rate of downslope creep [meters**2 / year]. Try values between 0.0002 and 0.02. 0.0005 Float
1e-4 1e-2
Proportion of slope constant in alluvial creep: Relative diffusivity of alluvium mass wasting to slope mass wasting. Generally set to 1. 1.0 Float
0.0 1.0
Switch to use critical slope gradient: If set to 1, use a critical slope gradient (CRITICAL_GRADIENT_USE, 0 or 1) 1 Int
0 1
Switch to use Roering mass wasting: If set to 1, use the Roering formula for mass wasting. Otherwise, use the Howard formula. The Roering formula allows a threshold maximum slope gradient in regolith. The Howard formula uses linear creep. 0 Int
0 1
Critical slope gradient: Maximum stable regolith gradient [no units] 0.8 Float
0.0 10.0
Slope gradient exponent: Used for the Howard two-term relationship. 3.0 Float
0.0 10.0
Maximum diffusity increase: Maximum allowed increase in mass wasting flux as gradients approach critical value. 0.025 Float
0.0 1.0
Slope failure diffusity: Near-failure mass wasting constant used in the Howard mass wasting model. 0.05 Float
0.0 1.0
Switch to use bistable fluvial erosion: If set to 1, use bistable fluvial erosion (HIGHRATEUSE, 0 or 1). Used for modeling gully development. 0 Int
0 1
Switch to use bistable bedrock: If set to 1, use bistable bedrock (BEDROCKHIGH, 0 or 1). Used for modeling gully development. 0 Int
0 1
Low erosion threshold: Only used with bistable erosion and gully development. 10.0 Float
0.0 100.0
High erosion threshold: Only used with bistable erosion and gully development. 15.0 Float
0.0 100.0
Erosion rate change lag: Only used with bistable erosion and gully development. 0.5 Float
0.0 10.0
Bistable critical shear: Only used with bistable erosion and gully development. 10.0 Float
0.0 100.0
Bistable runoff factor: Only used with bistable erosion and gully development. 1.0 Float
0.0 10.0
Bistable bedrock erodibility: Only used with bistable erosion and gully development. 5.0 Float
0.0 100.0
Switch to use random critical shear stress: If set to 1, use random critical shear stress (RANDTHRESHUSE, 0 or 1). 0 Int
0 1
Switch to use random discharge: If set to 1, use random discharge (RANDDISCHUSE, 0 or 1). 0 Int
0 1
Critical shear variability: Scale factor for random critical shear stress. 1.0 Float
0.0 1.0
Discharge coeff variation: Standard error of discharge, assuming a lognormal distribution. 2.0 Float
0.0 100.0
Omega weight: Governs inheritance from past value, similar to a Hurst parameter. Set to 1 for no inheritance. 1.0 Float
0.0 1.0
Switch to use 3D variable resistance weathering: If set to 1, use 3D variable resistance weathering (SLOPEVARUSE, 0 or 1) 0 Int
0 1
Switch to determine how resistance is computed: If set to 1, use RANDOM INPUT. Otherwise, use ABSOLUTE. 0 Int
0 1
Diffusivity variability: See documentation. 1.0 Float
0.0 10.0
Switch to use a resistant surface layer: If set to 1, use a resistant surface layer (CRUSTUSE, 0 or 1). Experimental, for simulating the effect of development of a "duricrust". See documentation. 0 Int
0 1
Surface layer thickness: Crust thickness, using same units as cell size. 0.01 Float
0.0 100.0
Surface layer resistance: Crust relative shear stress factor, greater than 1 for a resistant crust. 20.0 Float
0.0 100.0
Vertical resistance scale factor: Ratio of horizontal to vertical scales (1.0 if equal). Only used for 3D varying rock resistance. 1.0 Float
0.0 10.0
Switch to use rock deformation: (DEFORMUSE, 0 or 1). NOT IMPLEMENTED IN CURRENT VERSION. 0 Int
0 0
Deformation scale factor: NOT IMPLEMENTED IN CURRENT VERSION. 1.0 Float
1.0 1.0
Switch to model groundwater seepage: If set to 1, groundwater seepage is modeled (SEEPUSE, 0 or 1). 0 Int
0 1
Seepage iteration interval: Number of iterations between recalculation of groundwater flow 5 Int
0 10000
Switch for permeability rescaling: If set to 1, permeability in exponential vertical decay of permeability is scaled to the present land surface elevation. Otherwise it is scaled to the original land surface elevation (at the start of the simulation). 0 Int
0 1
Switch to show groundwater calculations: If set to 1, show groundwater calculations. 0 Int
0 1
Switch for exponential permeability decay: If set to 1, permeability is constant through an aquifer of constant thickness. Otherwise, it decays with depth below the surface. 1 Int
0 1
Yearly recharge rate: Yearly recharge rate [meters / year] 10.0 Float
0.0 1000.0
Viscosity of water: Viscosity of water (GIVE UNITS HERE) 0.0012 Float
1e-4 1e-2
Permeability, in darcies: Permeability [darcies] 1.0 Float
0.0 10.0
Groundwater depth scale: For exponential permeability, this is the depth to the half value of permeability. For constant permeability, it is the aquifer thickness. [meters] 200.0 Float
0.0 10000.0
Groundwater flow fraction: The fraction of surface water flow that becomes groundwater flow. (From docs "The amount of groundwater flow relative to the surface flow. Set to 1 for all groundwater flow.") 1.0 Float
0.0 1.0
Initial groundwater depth: Initial depth beneath the land surface for calculation of steady state groundwater surface. [meters(CHECK)] 1.0 Float
0.0 1000.0
Depth decay of permeability power: Set this to 1 for normal exponential decay. 1.0 Float
0.0 10.0
Max. groundwater iterations: Max number of iterations permitted in calculating steady state groundwater table. 4000 Int
0 100000
Max. groundwater error: Max residual error permitted in calculating steady state groundwater table. 0.0001 Float
1e-6 1e-2
Groundwater relaxation coeff: Coefficient used for SOR (successive over relaxation) 1.95 Float
0.0 10.0
Switch to use groundwater flux: If set to 0, the groundwater flow term used for seepage calculations of surface flows and weathering rate is the groundwater flux divergence (seepage rate to surface). Otherwise, it is the groundwater flow rate per unit aquifer width. 0 Int
0 1
Switch to use seepage averaging: If set to 1, the groundwater flow term used in further calculations is a 9 point average value of raw calculated values. 0 Int
0 1
Eolian event probability: Probability of an eolian deposition/erosion event per unit time (year or iteration) 1.0 Float
0.0 1.0
Eolian time increment: SCALES THE OVERALL EOLIAN EROSION/DEPOSITION RATE 100.0 Float
0.0 1000.0
Switch to use total exposure: If set to 1, all cells within the calculation window are used to compute the exposure index. Otherwise, only cells visible to the local cell are used. 0 Int
0 1
Switch to use default eolian process: If set to 1, eolian erosion and deposition occur normal to the topographic surface. Otherwise, erosion and deposition are modeled as vertical additions or subtractions. 1 Int
0 1
Minimum eolian deposition rate: THIS CAN BE NEGATIVE (IF EOLIAN EROSION OF EXPOSED LOCATIONS) -0.01 Float
-100.0 100.0
Maximum eolian deposition rate: GENERALLY UNITY AND SCALED BY EOLIAN_TIME_INCREMENT DETERMINES EOLIAN_CONSTANT_1 AND EOLIAN_CONSTANT_2 1.0 Float
-100.0 100.0
Eolian parameter code: Code that determines how next 2 parameters are used: (1) EXPOSURE_10_PERCENT, EXPOSURE_90_PERCENT, (2) EXPOSURE_50_PERCENT, EXPOSURE_90_PERCENT, (3) ZERO_PERCENT_EXPOSURE, EXPOSURE_90_PERCENT, (4) RATE0, EXPOSURE_50_PERCENT. 3 Int
1 4
Exposure parameter 1: Used to determine EOLIAN_CONSTANT_3 that defines the shape of the eolian erosion/deposition curve as related to the exposure index. -0.1 Float
-10.0 10.0
Exposure parameter 2: Used to determine EOLIAN_CONSTANT_3 that defines the shape of the eolian erosion/deposition curve as related to the exposure index. 0.2 Float
-10.0 10.0
Distance decay factor: In calculation of exposure index, this determines how rapidly the weighting of surrounding cells decays with distance. Also used for accretion/ablation modeling. 0.0 Float
0.0 100.0
Weighting calculation distance: The maximum distance (in number of cells) that elevations are used to calculate the exposure index. Also used for accretion/ablation modeling. 15 Int
0 100
Number of lava sources: Number of sources (vents, volcanoes) that are present on the surface. (Multiple sources not yet supported.) 1 Int
1 1
Lava source I coordinate: I coordinate (column) of lava source in DEM. 10 Int
1 2000
Lava source J coordinate: J coordinate (column) of lava source in DEM. 10 Int
1 2000
Lava event probability: Probability of a lava flow event during a single iteration. 0.12 Float
0.0 1.0
Minimum lava flow slope: Minimum gradient for laval flow at the flow source. 0.01 Float
0.0 10.0
Lava flow thickness: Assumed thickness of individual lava flow deposits [meters] 0.01 Float
0.0 10.0
Minimum lava flow thickness: Minimum thickness of a lava flow that can flow into adjoining cells [meters] 0.002 Float
0.0 10.0
New segment interval: Number of iterations before starting a new lava flow source. (CHECK THIS) 100 Int
0 10000
Source change interval: Number of iterations between changeover to a different lava flow source. 12500 Int
0 100000
Eruption stop probability: Probability, per iteration, that the existing flow will solidify and stop being active. If this happens, a new flow starts at the source. 0.0001 Float
0.0 1.0
No flow probability: The lower limit of probability for a cell to be a source for a new flow segment. If the probability drops below this value, then the cell is no longer considered to be a possible flow source. 0.005 Float
0.0 1.0
Lava gradient weight: Determines how much the gradient between the edge of a flow and the neighboring point determines the probability of flow in that direction. 28.0 Float
0.0 100.0
Lava duration weight: Determines how rapidly a new cell diminishes in probability that it can be the source of a flow into a neighboring cell. 0.14 Float
0.0 10.0
Impact probability: Probability of an impact event, per year. 0.0 Float
0.0 1.0
Switch for ejecta wraparound: If set to 1 and if the domain is periodic in both X and Y, then ejecta deposition can carry over onto the opposite side (IFOLD, 0 or 1) 0 Int
0 1
Switch for regolith crater: If set to 1, then crater slopes and ejecta are soft (regolith). Otherwise they are considered to be initially bedrock. 0 Int
0 1

Small crater shape exponent: Based upon scaling of fresh impact craters in Forsberg et al (2004) and Howard (2007). 0.113 Float
0.0 2.0
Crater frequency exponent: Based upon scaling of fresh impact craters in Forsberg et al (2004) and Howard (2007). 2.0 Float
0.0 5.0
Frequency cutoff scaling: Based upon scaling of fresh impact craters in Forsberg et al (2004) and Howard (2007). 0.35 Float
0.0 100.0
Smallest possible crater: Depends on the scale of the simulation, generally in meters. Generally keep at about (4 * cell_scale). 100.0 Float
0.0 1e5
Smallest modelled crater: Depends on the scale of the simulation, generally in meters. Generally keep at about (4 * cell_scale). 1000.0 Float
0.0 1e6
Largest modeled crater: Depends on the scale of the simulation, generally in meters. Generally keep at about (cell_scale * ncols / 2). 50000.0 Float
0.0 1e7
Ejecta thickness variability: Ejecta thickness variability (EXPLAIN) 0.2 Float
0.0 1e4
Noisesd: Standard deviation of random noise used for ejecta thickness. (CHECK THIS) 0.0 Float
0.0 1e4
Inheritance parameter: See documentation. 0.9 Float
0.0 2.0
Maximum rim gradient: Maximum gradient of crater rim [unitless] 0.36 Float
0.0 10.0
Switch for variable ocean elevation: If set to 1, ocean elevation varies in time and the times and corresponding sea levels are read in from the file "oceanlevels.dat". 0 Int
0 1
Accretion rate: Rate of non-fluvial and non-eolian surface accretion and degradation. -0.4 Float
-10.0 10.0
Switch for exposure dependent creep: If set to 1, the mass wasting creep rate depends on exposure. 0 Int
0 1
Switch for solar radiation: If set to 1, sublimation due to reflected radiation is modeled. 0 Int
0 1
Swith for top exposure: Please refer help 0 Int
0 1
Swith for inverse exposure: Please refer help 0 Int
0 1
Swith for exposure smoothing: Please refer help 0 Int
0 1
Radiation constant: This scales the rate of radiation-dependent sublimation/deposition. 2.0 Float
0.0 100.0
Radiation dust factor: Determines the relative amount of re-emitted thermal radiation from dust-covered surfaces relative to bedrock surfaces. 2.0 Float
0.0 100.0
Radiation threshold convexity: Critical value of exposure index for redeposition of sublimated ice. -0.2 Float
-10.0 10.0
Radiation deposit rate: Rate scaling for redeposition of sublimated ice on less-exposed surfaces. 0.00003 Float
0.0 1.0
HTML help file: URL for HTML help file http://csdms.colorado.edu/help/models/marssim/Marssim_help_doc.html String
